description.raw:
The idea comes from @jlee02 explained in [a different pull request](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2489/disable-tests-compilation-by-default-in/diff#comment-26266415). I'm point this change to default instead of gazebo7, seems pretty intrusive for me to include in a minor bump.

Remove the cmake `ENABLE_TESTS_COMPILATION` parameter and exclude all tests compilation from `make all` so a simple `make` call won't compile any single test file. 

The whole test suite can be compiled by running `make tests`. All the individual tests make targets are generated when calling `cmake` so they are available in the form of `make <binary_test_name>` (i.e `make UNIT_gz_TEST`).

Note that this PR should go in sync with [the corresponding release-tools PR](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/release-tools/pull-requests/325/adapt-gazebo-build-to-new-make-tests/diff) and [fixes to our install from source tutorial](#!/osrf/gazebo_tutorials/pull-requests/382/remove-enable_tests_compilation-from/diff).

Testing runs:

  * [Ubuntu Linux](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/720/)
  * [Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/All/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/746/)
